active_learning.discussion_prompt: Evaluate the role of continuous education in each phase of the NIST SP 800-61 Incident Response Lifecycle (Preparation, Detection/Analysis, Containment/Eradication/Recovery, Post-Incident Activity). Which phase benefits most from ongoing training, and why? Support your argument with examples from real-world breaches.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Incident Response. Use the following to create 40-60 high-quality Anki-style flashcards on 'Continuous Education Requirements' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > 002_Incident Response Lifecycle > 001_Preparation > 014_Training and Awareness > Continuous Education Requirements). **Completed Research Context:** Continuous education in IR/Forensics keeps skills current amid evolving threats. Core Concepts: IR (detect/respond per NIST 800-61), Forensics (evidence handling), Continuous Education (CPE via training/certs). Standards: NIST SP 800-61 r3 (Preparation training, https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/61/r3/final); (ISC)² CISSP (120 CPEs/3yrs, https://www.isc2.org/cpe); GIAC (36 CEUs/4yrs, https://www.giac.org/continuing-education/); ISO 27001 Cl.7.2 (competence, https://www.iso.org/standard/27001); CIS Controls v8 Safeguard 7 (https://www.cisecurity.org/controls); NIST CSF 2.0 (Govern: Awareness training). Sources: NIST, (ISC)², GIAC, ISO, CIS. **Learning Objectives:** [Insert full list from above]. **Scaffolding Layers:** [Insert full scaffolding from above]. Prerequisite: Link initial training (014) to continuous. **Active Learning:** [Insert full active learning from above] – reference in flashcards. **Flashcard Generation Rules:** - Balance: 10-15 cards/layer, span Bloom's (Remember 20%, Understand 20%, Apply 20%, Analyze 15%, Evaluate 15%, Create 10%). - Use schema: Front (MCQ/cloze/short), Back (Answer | Explanation | Reference | Layer | Active Link). - Distractors: [Insert distractor protocol]. - Make engaging: Use scenarios, avoid rote; explanations scaffold to higher layers. - Output JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'reference': '...', 'layer': '1', 'active_link': 'Discussion prompt'}}]. Generate now.
